segments.text: I see the woman standing in the puddle, and she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and she’s completely focused on that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, and I can’t believe how close he is to falling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie, like this is all normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the whole scene is a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever realize what’s going on behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the floor, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel like I should say something before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and the woman won’t even notice until it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think I need to step in before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole situation is just ridiculous.
segments.speaker: PAR
